text: Kabul Tower, also referred to as the MOC Tower and Telecom Tower is an 18-story high-rise building in Kabul, Afghanistan. With a height of 87 metres (285 ft) to the tip and an architectural height of 75 metres (246 ft), the Kabul Tower is the tallest building in Afghanistan. Kabul Tower is a government office building and serves as the Headquarters of the Ministry of Communications and Information Technology (Afghanistan) == See also == * List of tallest buildings and structures in Afghanistan == References == Category:Skyscrapers in Afghanistan Category:Government of Afghanistan
title: Kabul Tower
